data.author: Marcello Brivio

changelog.release_notes: Upon popular request, temperature is now available in Farenheit degrees, too.

The short story: the "Loading..." issue on temperature and weather is now fixed. Enjoy!
The long story: starting on October 9th, OpenWeatherMap is requiring an API Key for their services to be invoked by external apps. I didn't get any warining, so I didn't noticed the bug untill some Pebble Verbose Watchface users wrote me about it. Sorry for this. Everything should be OK now.
New Feature: now the color combination is inverted (dark text on clear background) when the Pebble is not connected to your phone, giving you a more immediate view of the Bluetooth connection status.

- Added support for Basalt SDK: now you can install this watchface on Pebble Time!
- Minor bug fixing
Minor update for improved text positioning.
First official release, tested and running on my black Pebble ;-)

data.description:
In this watchface you won't find beautiful graphics or cool typography to please your eyes: only data, displayed with a terminal-inspired look & feel for the little nerd living inside everyone of us...

The Verbose Watchface displays in a single Pebble window all the following informations:

- 24 hours clock
- 12 hours clock
- Seconds
- Date
- Weekday
- Yearly week number
- Yearly day number
- Watchface uptime (tip: refreshing the watchface you can use this to start a simple time counter!)
- BlueTooth connection status
- Battery level %
- Temperature and conditions for your location (data from openweathermap.org) updated every 30 minutes.

Is this enough?

latest_release.release_notes: Upon popular request, temperature is now available in Farenheit degrees, too.

data.title: Verbose Watchface for Pebble
